Certainly! If you're interested in seeing traditional Mayan arts and crafts in person, some recommendations are:

1. Chichicastenango Market in Guatemala: This market is famous for its beautiful textiles, masks, and pottery. It takes place every Thursday and Sunday.

2. Mercado de Artesanias in Oaxaca, Mexico: This large outdoor market is a great place to see and purchase a wide variety of indigenous arts and crafts from all over Mexico, including Mayan textiles and pottery.

3. Museo Regional de Antropologia in Merida, Mexico: This museum has a large collection of Mayan artifacts, including pottery, textiles, and other crafts.

4. Casa del Jade in Antigua, Guatemala: This store specializes in high-quality jade jewelry and other crafts made by Mayan artisans.

5. Aj Quen in Panajachel, Guatemala: This shop sells a beautiful selection of handwoven Mayan textiles, including traditional huipils (blouses) and other clothing.

These are just a few recommendations - there are many other places throughout Mexico and Central America where you can see and learn about traditional Mayan arts and crafts in person.
